word.name: CAT
word.description: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractable claws.

word.name: DOG
word.description: A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and is often kept as a pet or working animal.

word.name: SUN
word.description: The star around which the Earth orbits, providing light and heat to the planet.

word.name: RUN
word.description: To move rapidly on foot; to sprint or jog.

word.name: HAT
word.description: A covering for the head, typically with a brim and a crown.

word.name: RED
word.description: A color at the end of the spectrum next to orange and opposite violet, as the color of blood, fire, or rubies.

word.name: BOOK
word.description: A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers.

word.name: TREE
word.description: A woody perennial plant, typically having a single main stem or trunk, supporting branches and leaves.

word.name: BALL
word.description: A round or spherical object used in various sports and games.

word.name: JUMP
word.description: To propel oneself upwards or forwards into the air, using one's feet and legs.

word.name: MILK
word.description: A white liquid produced by mammary glands of mammals, often consumed as a beverage.

word.name: RAIN
word.description: Precipitation in the form of liquid water droplets that fall from the atmosphere.

word.name: BLUE
word.description: A color resembling the clear sky on a sunny day.

word.name: FISH
word.description: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins, living wholly in water.

word.name: DUCK
word.description: A waterbird with a broad flat bill, webbed feet, and a quack sound.

word.name: SHIP
word.description: A large watercraft for transporting goods or passengers by sea.

word.name: FACE
word.description: The front part of a person's head, from the forehead to the chin, or the corresponding part in an animal.

word.name: SMILE
word.description: A pleased, kind, or amused facial expression, typically with the corners of the mouth turned up and the front teeth exposed.

word.name: WIND
word.description: The natural movement of the air, especially in the form of a current of air blowing from a particular direction.

word.name: FROG
word.description: An amphibian with a short squat body, moist skin, and long hind legs for leaping.

word.name: CAKE
word.description: A sweet baked food made from a mixture of flour, sugar, eggs, and other ingredients, usually with icing on top.

word.name: STAR
word.description: A luminous point in the night sky that is a large, remote incandescent body like the sun.

word.name: MOON
word.description: The natural satellite of the Earth, visible by reflection of sunlight and appearing as a shining disk in the night sky.

word.name: BIRD
word.description: A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate with feathers, wings, and a beak.

word.name: SNOW
word.description: Atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals and falling in light white flakes or lying on the ground as a white layer.

word.name: DOOR
word.description: A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle, or in the framework of a cupboard.

word.name: SONG
word.description: A musical composition with lyrics for voice or voices, performed by singing.

word.name: FROG
word.description: An amphibian with a short squat body, moist skin, and long hind legs for leaping.

word.name: LEAF
word.description: The flattened structure of a higher plant, typically green and blade-like, that is attached to a stem directly or via a stalk.

word.name: KING
word.description: A male ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.

word.name: NEST
word.description: A structure or place made or chosen by a bird for laying eggs and sheltering its young.

word.name: ANT
word.description: A small insect, often with a sting, that usually lives in a complex social colony with one or more breeding queens.

word.name: BEAR
word.description: A large, heavy mammal with thick fur and a short tail, including the polar bear, brown bear, and black bear.

word.name: EGG
word.description: The rounded reproductive body produced by the female of certain animals, consisting of an ovum surrounded by layers of membranes and an outer casing.

word.name: FIRE
word.description: The process of combustion manifested in light, flame, and heat.

word.name: GOAT
word.description: A domesticated ruminant mammal with backward-curving horns, related to the sheep and capable of producing milk.

word.name: HOUSE
word.description: A building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people.

word.name: JUICE
word.description: The liquid obtained from or present in fruit or vegetables.

word.name: LAMP
word.description: A device for giving light, consisting of a source of illumination and a glass or transparent cover that encloses the light source.

word.name: PARK
word.description: A large public green area in a town, used for recreation.

word.name: QUEEN
word.description: A female ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by right of birth.

word.name: ROCK
word.description: A large rugged mass of hard mineral material or stone.

word.name: SEED
word.description: The mature fertilized ovule of a flowering plant, capable of developing into another such plant.

word.name: TIGER
word.description: A large carnivorous feline mammal with a yellowish-brown coat striped with black.

word.name: WATER
word.description: A colorless, transparent, odorless, and tasteless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain.

word.name: ZOO
word.description: An establishment that maintains a collection of wild animals, typically in a park or gardens, for study, conservation, or display to the public.

word.name: APPLE
word.description: A round fruit with red or green skin and a whitish interior.

word.name: CANDY
word.description: Sweet food made with sugar or syrup combined with fruit, chocolate, or nuts.

word.name: FARM
word.description: An area of land and its buildings used for growing crops and rearing animals.

word.name: JOKE
word.description: A form of entertainment, consisting of typically humorous remarks, intended to make an audience laugh.
